cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest and slowing, expected to turn north and come ashore along the central South Carolina coast, then meander just inland before drifting northeastward mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Charleston, South Carolina coast (Savannah River–Little River Inlet stretch)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – only the South Carolina coast is under consideration for watches at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Savannah River to Little River Inlet, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeastern U.S. coast from northern Georgia through coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (≤3 %) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; prevailing winds expected to remain below gale force at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the west-central Florida coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall associated with BONNIE is expected at the Tampa Port Authority.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal – possible increase in Atlantic rip currents well east of the port, but no operational impact in Tampa Bay.
